page.title: 03 INGESTRE FARM
page.content: Ingestre is a farming community on the outskirts of Stafford. Home farm situated near Ingestre is owned by Mr. Andrew Collier. Originally the 20th Earl of Shrewsbury owned it. Ingestre farm concentrates on growing mainly mainly arable crops such as barley, wheat and potatoes. The wheat and grain are bought by a merchant. The potatoes are mainly for human consumption although a small amount go for animal fodder. Altogether there are 250 square acres of which a small percentage is used for the grazing of cattle and horses which are stabled in the grounds. The farm is soon to be a family concern when Mr. Collier shares it with his father and brother.
